intro: Stemonurus merrittii, commonly known as the Florida bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils in swampy or wetland habitats. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, showy blooms from late spring to early summer. Stemonurus merrittii is often found in the Florida Panhandle and parts of Georgia, where it thrives in wet, open environments.
